result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul J Garchek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of supervision.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.  Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must be compliant with any family court or child support orders. Firearm warning. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Paul J Garchek in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Paul J Garchek in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 04-20-2105/tk
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties are in receipt of PSI and numerous letters in support of defendant. No additions or corrections noted by the State. Defense puts correction on the record. The State recommends incarceration but does not recommend a number. Defense indicates that he is in complete disagreement with the PSI writers assessment of the deft. Defense asks for I/S with lengthy probation with RCJ time/CFTS and that deft be immediately put in Behavioral Cons program.

BTC: 14CF1183-Total sentence is 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES - consec to 14CF1185
